description:
Kousuke Ueki, a student of the Hinokuni Junior High School, is picked by a God Candidate, Koba-sen, to participate in a competition where people battle out to become God and only the strongest will prevail. Embodied with the ability to turn garbage into trees, Kousuke will be joining in the battle against other junior high school students in this selection. This sets the premise for the earth-friendly battle where the students will pit their powers against the rest.

(Source: Anime News Network)

tags.name: Shounen
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult males.

tags.name: Gods
tags.description: Prominently features a character of divine or religious nature.

tags.name: Super Power
tags.description: Prominently features characters with special abilities that allow them to do what would normally be physically or logically impossible.

tags.name: Urban Fantasy
tags.description: Set in a world similar to the real world, but with the existence of magic or other supernatural elements.

tags.name: Battle Royale
tags.description: Centers around a fierce group competition, often violent and with only one winner.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/romiansaran)

She announced her marriage to fellow voice actor [Kazuhiro Yamaji](https://anilist.co/staff/101755) on January 22, 2020.

Many fans have mistaken photos of Romi Park as photos of [Hiromu Arakawa](https://anilist.co/staff/96874), the mangaka of Fullmetal Alchemist, because of one particular image in which Park poses as a mangaka. Park is also known for representing Arakawa in public events Arakawa is not able to attend.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/fukuchi_tsubasa) | [pixiv](https://www.pixiv.net/users/18447348) | [Mangano](https://manga-no.com/@fukuchi283/mangafolio)

Tsubasa Fukuchi is a Japanese Mangaka.

__Kumi Koda__ is a Japanese singer from Kyoto, known for her urban and R&B songs.

After debuting with the single "Take Back" in December 2000, Koda gained fame in March 2003 when the songs from her seventh single, "Real Emotion/1000 no Kotoba", were used as themes for the video game Final Fantasy X-2. Her popularity grew with the release of her fourth studio album Secret (2005), her sixteenth single "Butterfly" (2005), and her first greatest hits album Best: First Things (2005), reaching the number-three, number-two, and number-one spots respectively.

Though her early releases presented a conservative, quiet image, since as early as 2003 Koda has adopted a sexier and more provocative style. Because of this image, she has become a fashion leader among young women, setting trends such as the ero-kakkoii style. In 2006 and 2007, Oricon named Koda as the top selling artist of the year.

(Source: Wikipedia)

Originating from [Studio Live](https://anilist.co/studio/6460/), where he studied under [Ashida Toyoo](https://anilist.co/staff/110953/).

He made his debut as in-betweener on [Manga Nihon Emaki](https://anilist.co/anime/9856/) and became a key animator on [Cyborg 009](https://anilist.co/anime/4690/) but it was his work as animation director on the [Minky Momo](https://anilist.co/anime/518/) series that brought him recognition and he was asked to draw illustrations of Momo. Subsequently he became the character designer for the later OVAs.

In 1986 he made his debut as director on [Kyoushoku Soukou Guyver](https://anilist.co/anime/2293/). Following some more work as animator he switched to directing in the beginning of the '90s. He is nowadays affiliated with [Studio Deen](https://anilist.co/studio/37/).
A Japanese anime director, storyboard artist, and animator.
A Japanese anime director, storyboard artist, and animator.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/福冨博) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hiroshi_Fukutomi)

Originating from [Shin-Ei Animation](https://anilist.co/studio/247/)

Married to animator [Kazuko Fukutomi](https://anilist.co/staff/157057/).

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/岡真里子)

Originating from Studio Live. Notable works as a character designer include [Jigoku Shoujo](https://anilist.co/anime/228/), [Ghost Hound](https://anilist.co/anime/2596/) and [Nurarihyon no Mago](https://anilist.co/anime/7592/). Close friends with [Hiroshi Watanabe](https://anilist.co/staff/101189/), and often designs the characters for the shows which he directs.

He is an animator and character designer. Motohashi started working at Studio Z. Later, after leaving Studio Z, he started together with Hirayama Satoshi and Kamegaki Hajime Studio Z5. Today he is affiliated with Xebec and is the representative director of its subsidiary Xebec M2.
Shouji Hata is an Audio Engineer.

Originating from [Studio Deen](https://anilist.co/studio/37/), where he initially worked as a composite artist.

_Note: Not to be confused with the [other director](https://anilist.co/staff/101468/) by the same name._
Fumiko Harada is a music director born in Tachikawa, Tokyo, Japan. She is married with the music producer Kurosu Reo since 2009.
